title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: First off, most of the negative reviews about this speaker are due to counterfeit merchandise being delivered. My speaker came from an authorized dealer and shows no signs of being fake. It's the real deal.That being said, I can't see why anyone would choose to keep this speaker, let alone write any sort of positive review. My disappointment with this product is two fold.Firstly, the sound quality is terrible. Jbl is supposed to be a brand known for premium sound, but this product misses that mark entirely. I wouldn't even call it budget sound. I've owned over 20 bluetooth speakers, and I've heard better sound out of a product costing a quarter of what Jbl does. Despite having 2 subs on either side, the bass quality is terrible. I listen to primarily rock music, which mostly needs the bare minimum as far as low range is concerned, and this speaker can't even handle that. The sound is terribly muddled and any sort of bass that is delivered drives right over any high range leaving the listener yearning for even a cassette-tape-in-a-stock-yugo quality of sound. Just abhorrent that Jbl could confidently put their brand on this crap.  I toyed around with different settings and equalizers for an hour. The sound is just garbage.My second issue is volume. This is categorized as a "portable" Bluetooth speaker, and it is, however it lies much on the bigger side of that portable range. For its size, it is shockingly unable to pump out the volume. To give you an idea, I mainly bought this speaker to have in my work truck, which is a tiny 2 seater truck cab. A speaker this size, or even smaller, should have no problem filling that truck cab with sound. And yet it doesn't. It's almost impressive how lacking it is in volume. I'm literally amazed at how weak it is for its size.  Tried listening to it in my apartment as well, at full volume in the kitchen I could barely hear it 15 ft away in my bedroom. With how big this unit is I should be able to hear the words of a song from anywhere in my little apartment, but yet again, this speaker amazes in its lackluster performance.There are other things I could say, but I'll just leave it at that. I'm sending this back immediately for a refund and will likely never go with Jbl for my portable sound needs ever again. Much better sound and volume can be had for much less cost. Stay away from this one.

title: Speaker stopped working
text: Yes, only 1 star.Buyers beware: After 30 days, there are no returns.We bought 3 units in good faith.The first unit began to turn itself off randomly after only 4 months. When this happens, you have to go through bluetooth pairing process. Since this happens over and over, this is impossibly time-consuming and quite frustrating.The second unit stopped receiving a charge 10 days after the first unit failed. It no longer receives a charge.After 2 units failed, we thought we better look for a different product and attempted to initiate a return on all 3. The idea was to protect ourselves against missing the 6 month or 1 year warranty period.No such luck.Amazon ignored our attempts to contact altogether. In fact, there is no way to reach Amazon to discuss the inequity of a 30 day return policy nor any other issue that isn't on their service menu. It seems to be an increasingly popular, clever way of denying service and placing all risk upon consumers.Let's be specific: HAD WE KNOWN WE ONLY HAD 30 DAYS TO RETURN AN ELECTRONIC DEVICE, WE NEVER WOULD HAVE PURCHASED IT.This isn't a roll of toilet paper (you know what you've got when you receive it).Electronic devices require at least 6 months or 1 year warranty - or why bother at all?In fact, if JBL/Harman only warranties for 30 days... it's reasonable to think they know it's a garbage product and not going to last.The lack of accountability or service isn't the only issue with the JBL Charge 3... it is also very frustrating to use. The 'smart' button controls everything, but works with such latency (press a button... wait... it may take up to 30 seconds to respond - or not) and inconsistency (press same button... get different results) that it is mostly an exercise in frustration.There are no operational indicators; it emits a sound... that happens whether it's working or not. So you effectively operate blind. You'll need an instruction manual every time you attempt to troubleshoot this unit or expect a daisy-chain of dysfunction randomly pressing the one button looking for luck/success.Back to the 30 day no return... I would never choose to gamble on a 30 day return policy - on practically any product - let alone on electronic devices that are now manufactured as cheaply as possible. Consumer protection is a thing of the past, when '30 days no return' is acceptable.We decided to return over $1,000 more electronics we purchased recently through Amazon, before it's too late.P.S. If you're set on purchasing a JBL Charge 3, buy one or all of ours! We're selling the new ones we receive before we open them.

title: The only review of this speaker you will need to read
text: Stopped pairing with other Charge 3 after a short time out of warrantee. Even worse, there are no service centers anywhere in San Diego CA forcing me to incur expensive shipping costs for two Charge 3s testing and any repairs, as there is no way of determining which one has the problem!

title: BUYERS BEWARE: NO RETURNS after only 30 days... not traditional JBL quality manufacturing; this is junk.
text: I bought this product in good faith in 2017. It turned me into a fairly decent sized fan of JBL. The sound quality on the ones that I had purchased were very very good .untill they started getting a little older ,when the battery started going bad on them. Now I have to keep them plugged in all the time otherwise they won’t work at all .when I contacted JBL not to get anything for free but to repair the components that I already own, I got no response. Only a response from the people that are dealing this product, that’s telling me the warranty is over and we don’t repair the items. So basically if your component breaks after the warranty you can’t get it fixed ?just throw it away and buy another one like they want you to do ? why would anybody buy any product that the manufacture does not stand behind their product. I didn’t even mention the one that I bought for my brother-in-law as a Christmas present that when charging it for two hours one evening, self-destructed and almost burned the house down. And no they were not miss charged. So I guess if you’re the type that likes to buy throwaway items this is a product for you ..after all they do sound very nice when they are working but I guess after they quit working can you just simply throw them in the trash can because after that they are worthless .no one to help fix them, JBL being the top people that should be helping the customer but they are not! I am going to move on now, not ever buying another JBL product. Hope you people get wise and do the same. After all, I am just trying to help the fellow customer, because no one else seems to have our back.

title: Beware - It's a "Land mine"!
text: Multiple failures on this unit almost simultaneously -- never beat on it, never got it wet, dropped, nothing, rarely even played loud.  First:  speakers are crackling like crazy - did quick internet search and appears to be a known problem that glue (get that, "glue") used to fix speakers in frames loosens and speakers vibrate and crackle, big time.  Second:  at about the same time, battery life completely died.Called JBL -- totally useless customer service -- guy said four years is pretty good, which is nonsense.  Could understand maybe battery loosing recharge capacity after awhile, but speaker failure is major design flaw.  JBL will take no responsibility for this.They did offer to give me a 10% credit on a new unit.Too bad, frankly, not sure what to do now -- did a lot of research, including ordered and returned many units (Amazon Prime...) before found this unit which was by far the best sound/volume quality in price range.Just craps out and is a throw away after 4 years.FURTHER NOTE:  the "common" failure method that appears on various youtube "fix-it" videos is that either the glue holding the speaker in the frame or the glue holding the magnet on the speaker back has come loose.  Not the case for me:  the speaker is totally blown.Inexcusable after 4 years of light use and pampering.Otherwise, these are (were...) great units

title: Worst customer service ever, they do not stand behind their product
text: I bought 3 of these speakers for use in my coffee shop. I originally bought 2, but one was acting up so I thought it might be defective, and bought a 3rd just to have backup. All 3 of them didn't last 6 months. I thought it may be the batteries, so I actually bought 3 batteries at $20 each and paid a tech guy to install them for me. Guess what? The speakers still don't work. Won't hold a charge, if it will even turn on at all. Now I'm out about $720 all together and had to go back to using a radio in my coffee shop. Very unhappy with this garbage. Was ecstatic at first with sound quality, the ability to hook up multiple speakers, but it was short lived. Customers did not touch these speakers. We kept them away from their reach. This was due to normal usage. Would not recommend unless you don't care about longevity and don't mind lighting money on fire.

title: Fantastic for 4 Years, Then - TOTAL CRACK UP
text: With 6% negative reviews I decided to register my Charge 3.  Using Google I found the JBL registration page and hundreds of items were listed, but not a single JBL Bluetooth product.  No email addresses listed for product support - just a single 1-800 number ... that would be a fool's' errand so I did not even try it.Yes, JBL claims a warranty in their bundled literature, but no web site mentioned, no nothing.  Using Google I was able to find JBL's product registration page but not a single Bluetooth item is referenced.  Nothing.  I was unable to register my Charge 3.  JBL takes my money with an ear-to-ear grin and turns its back on me. And you.In 1925 Benito Mussolini was asked during a radio interview to define Fascism & he replied that it as a conjoining of the largest corporations with the federal government thus creating a Mega-Force not answerable to anyone, not even to themselves.  We have arrived at that moment.  Big government is in bed the largest corporations and vice versa, hence the coinage of a new term, "corporatism".  I feel as if I am dealing with a faceless, anonymous and irreproachable behemoth.The Charge 3 works perfectly but if something were to go awry then I am SOL.  Not a good way to run a company.Caveat emptor!

title: Purchased 3, they didn't last 6 months
text: *UPDATE*The speaker turned on but the speakers were blown. Nothing but static!!  I don’t understand why someone would even send a defective product in such terrible condition!!The speaker arrived with dirt stains and obviously used!!  Looks like it’s been kicked around!  Didn’t even hook it up to see if it works. Probably not!!!

title: No way to register item making the warranty non-existent.
text: Received this item on Friday for my daughters Bday. On Saturday she opened it all excited and within minutes had it ready to play. That’s when we noticed something was off. The sound was crap!! Which was hard to believe because my brother has the exact same speaker and he loves it. So we played around with it and noticed something seemed off, so we pulled up the Amazon order and noticed that the item inside the box was what we thought was the charge 3 but it was some crappy looks like knock off speaker. Duffle differences were the logos and once my brother brought his over it was very clear on the switch. This made a great day feel like I got ripped off so back in the box this price of trash went.If you buy, open first and give it a good looking at.

title: VERY USED and BROKEN
text: This is the second portable JBL speaker I have owned and had and the same thing happen to now. My speaker 100% works fine then out of nowhere it will no longer charge. So now I have a brick that can not be disposed of in any responsible manner. Mind you the unit is completely sealed and you open you have to cut it open. When I called to have them repair it since it could be as simple as just changing a charging port maybe they said they can not do anything and I just need to purchase a new one. I do not want a new product I want this one to be fixed and not have more trash created. This item is only 3 years old and have no signs of wear even. Completely unnacceptable.**Update I fixed it myself. I turned it on and was disgusted of the sound quality. I bought a Bose bluetooth speaker when this broke and wow how much better the sounds from that is.

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: Don't buy from this seller!This speaker was great until it broke. Contacted JBL/Harman and learned it wasn't a true JBL product. Email from JBL's customer support:************Thank you very much for the response and for the information you have provided.Upon inspection, we have determined that this is not a genuine product.  Sadly, counterfeit products hurt us all, and since we did not manufacture or sell this product, we are unable to support it.  It would be best to contact your dealer for support.  We would also advise getting the Better Business Bureau and your credit card issuer involved.To avoid purchasing counterfeit or defective items, always look for a reputable dealer or visit our websites to purchase directly.  When purchasing directly you receive the following benefits:-  Genuine products-  Free Extended Returns-  Direct warranty-  Lifetime support-  Exclusive offersTo add some details, what gave it away was that the back panel as a card slot. The JBL Charge 3 that we have does not have a card slot as well as all the details that would supposed to be engraved on the back panel is not shown as well aside from it not having a serial number.

title: Speaker stopped working
text: I’ve had this for about a year and 4 months and it worked great. I use it at work where we can’t have headphones but we can use a portable speaker. It would run for 4-5 hours every day and had to charge it every 2-3 days. A few weeks ago the battery started to die after about 4 hours playing at 60-70% volume.Today I plugged it in when I got home and after an hour charging the battery caught fire and almost set fire to a dresser that the speaker was sitting on. It ruined my white  furniture anyway.Amazon customer service was excellent. They refunded me the money I paid for the speaker. I also contacted JBL but they didn’t respond yet. I will update the review when I get a response from them.

title: COUNTERFEIT!
text: There are 5 white led lights on the bottom of this speaker to indicate the current charge level.When I recieved this speaker 3 out of the 5 leds were lit upon turning it on. Typically electronics do not come fully charged so this was not a big deal.After testing the speaker for a half hour and performing a firmware upgrade, I decided to turn the speaker off and let it fully charge. Three hours later all the led lights were off indicating if was done charging, however upon turning the speaker on only 3 out of 5 leds lit up. I then preceeded to leave it on the charger another 4  hours and the same result happened. *JBL indicates this speaker fully charges in 4.5 hours according to their spec sheet.*  I charged it for 7.Since, this speaker is sold by a 3rd party seller and fulfilled by Amazon I decided to return it and order it directly through JBL for the same price with free two-day shipping.Had this item been *both* sold and fufilled by Amazon I may have simply swapped it out but because I prefer not to deal with a third party it's simply getting returned.

title: Great until it caught fire
text: I'm a delivery driver and I use the speaker to and from work and all day driving around. The speaker was great for the first year. Loud enough to hear in my work truck and the battery would need charging after the second day. About a year in it needed charging every night, and now, a few months later, it lasts 38 minutes and then shuts off. I have to charge it on road multiple times or just leave it plugged in.I probably ran it 9-10 hours a day, 5 days a week and then around the house on the weekends while doing work/projects. I'm not sure if that counts as really heavy use but if it's not usable in a little over a year it's trash. Literally. Something like this should last a lot longer. I'll stay away from JBL from now on.

title: Would Not Fully Charge
text: TLDR: DON'T UPDATE YOUR FIRMWARE IF YOU WANT TO USE THE AUX CABLEI wound't criticize too much the sound quality. After all, everyone likes heavy bass nowadays. For those that don't like the muddy sound, be prepared to do some EQing on your own.The real problem with the product is purely related to its firmware. The startup sound is so loud and cannot be turned off even with the latest firmware update. I bought the speaker to listen to music, not to announce to the rest of the world that I purchased JBL's product.Speaking of the firmware, ever since I upgraded it, the aux cable stops working properly. Unless my device continuously generates audio signal, the speaker would go into standby mode almost instantly. To recover from the standby mode, it will take a few seconds' delay. Have fun with all your online meetings where the first few words of your colleagues/profs get eaten. It makes me wonder if they even test their products at all before releasing. And yes, the update is irreversible.I regret wasting my money on this poorly designed product.

title: The battery died after a year and two months
text: Wasn’t impressed with the sound at all. Seems sort of shallow and anemic. Plugged it in to pc to watch tv show and it varied from being too loud to being too hard to hear low voices and sounds. Wish i had a chance to hear them before i bought them. Don’t even use it. Was so unimpressed, decided to do surgery on my crappy speaker it was to replace to change the battery.  I prefer my crappy frankenspeaker over this one. That being said, MAYBE with a decent software equalizer they would be a lot better? Can’t seem to get mine to work.

title: Annoying startup sound and broken aux cable support after firmware update
text: I got 2 Charge 3s for use out by the firepit. I specifically got 2 so I could use the JBL app to pair them individually as L/R for true stereo. I could connect to them individually and together just fine with my Note 9 and they sounded great, but I absolutely could not get the JBL Connect app to detect them. I called JBL tech support and did what they said to do and still no luck, so the tech contacted the JBL Connect developers and he said that he was told that the app was "under maintenance for a month or two and will be unusable until after that."Well, either that's a total BS answer (which is what I think), or it's legitimately what's going on. Either way, that is completely unacceptable support after blowing a couple of hundred bucks on a product.I probably would have given the Charge 3s 4 stars based on how they sounded as I got them to work if the app had worked as advertised, but the issue with the app is just not acceptable.

title: Meh!
text: I was hoping to use 4 of these, one pair each in 2 rooms. Evidently if you only need one of these you are golden. When I paired the second speaker it would drop out continuously through playing a song, very annoying.When I turned the first pair off and went to the second pair neither one would be recognized as a bluetooth source on my IPhone.I spent over an hour on the phone with JBL support and of course they wanted me to go to bluetooth settings, forget all Charge 3 speakers, restart phone, restore speakers to factory settings, restart speakers, (which means you now have to rename each one) and after all of that the speakers were still not found on my IPhone.I knew bluetooth speakers aren't nearly as bombproof as internet connection speakers, but I was trying to save a few hundred dollarsHave returned the charge 3s and ordered Sonos play 1s, those rarely have issues, and don't involve 20 mins of screwing around with your phone and speakers to try to make them work

title: Sounds great. App and JBL support suck.
text: Bought 2 of these in October 2020. One blew in April 2021, produces extremely distorted sound. The other blew in June 2021. I've been attempting to get the first one warrantied since April, it has become obvious that it is company policy to ignore all warranty requests, so basically there is no warranty. So the only thing worse than these speakers is the company that makes them. I paid $240 to use what were mediocre speakers when they worked for a matter of months. I would recommend Oontz. These were never as loud as the Oontz and the only thing we ever connected to it was our phones.  We've never had a problem with any other speaker blowing.

title: Great if you only need one
text: Incredible sound.  Great design.  I really liked and would love to have this speaker again - if it worked.  After recharging it successfully about 10 times, it stopped taking a charge completely.  Customer service was great at first - walked me through all the home tests & reset options to no avail then sent me a new speaker.  New speaker successfully charged about 8 times then stopped taking a charge.  Went through all the precious home tests & rest options on my own before contacting customer service and was told I would need to purchase a new speaker and there was nothing more they could do.  Great speaker if you only need it to work a few moths.

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: I’ve had my JBL speaker for 1.5 years and it’s already showing issues. The battery will no longer charge. When I called customer service they said this was normal and offered me 30% to buy a new one. I don’t appreciate companies that make faulty junk just so you can buy the new model. Great speaker but I won’t buy from this company again.

title: Speaker stopped working
text: I bought my JBL Charge 3 at the end of November (2017).It was in perfect condition. In March I jumped with it underwater, when lifting it out, the music was distorted, and it went off. I let it dry in the sun. When it was dry I let it charge, the light didn’t go on as an indication of charging, I still left it to charge.After a few hours of leaving it, I picked it up and shook it to hear that there’s still water inside, I opened my speaker (with the help of a YouTube video) to get the water out, there was a ton of water in. After pouring out the water I closed and sealed everything neatly.To date I just left the speaker in my room.Just for information, everything was neatly sealed when I Jumped with it in the swimming pool. I made sure of that.I’m utterly disappointed in the product as it is supposed to be waterproof.

title: Doesn’t work long term, no point in purchasing
text: For some time now, I get really pissed off when things I buy break down. Yes they may go past a warrantee period, is that the manner of purchasing we should expect when we buy things now a days? I purchase this JBL Charge 3 Waterproof Portable Bluetooth Speaker (Camouflage) back in October of 2019. This time frame doesn't seem fair for the unit to stop charging. Worst than that it's been going off when it's plugged into to power; ready for the garbage. It goes with out mush say that I want more from purchases I spend my hard earned money on, so I won't be buying this product again. I work hard, I like to listen to good music, I'll have to look into a better way. R

title: Waterproof
text: Bought this back in Dec 2018. For a while I was using it and it seemed fine. Was able to charge just fine with no issues. Realized today that while I was using it at my work (while in an air conditioned room), the speaker became really hot and melted the case of the speaker. I thought to myself that I could warranty it through JBL. Then I look for the serial number, and it was peeled off! I looked up this issue to see if there are other JBL CHARGE 3 that have had a thermal overheating issue, and there was a case where a JBL CHARGE 3 melted the case and caught on fire. Similar to what's starting to happen to my speaker. I also did some research and came across a youtube video of another consumer inspecting their JBL speaker with no serial number that was ordered from Today's Deals aka the vendor for this product.

title: Bad battery quality.
text: The box looked legit however upon opening, the inside box contents was crushed. I knew something was wrong and listened to it and it just didn't sound right. I decided to do further internet search and discovered that there were counterfeit JBL charge 3  speakers floating around. I looked into the one I received and realized it was a fake. It had green leds not white like the original and the logo (CHARGE 3)  was not on the back waterproof door. The unit did not have any serial numbers on it or the box. The top rubber of the power button was raised more than the original one and the JBL logo on the front is bigger than the orginal. I immediately returned the item after discovering it was a counterfeit.

title: Dangerous, thermal issues! NO SERIAL NUMBER!
text: I don’t usually write reviews but this one is needed. Be very careful using this product on hikes or adventures. JBL doesn’t provide any place to attach to the speaker for carabiner, clips, or leash. So you’re forced to use 3rd party case that provides theattachment. Problem is the cases are loose so the speaker falls out and there’s nothing to keep it from doing so. Unfortunately this was one of the last times I saw the speaker. I tripped on a trail in the Na Pali coast jarring the speaker out of case and down hill into river, never to be seen again. It’s too bad Bc the speaker worked great all trip in the water kayaking and everything. They simply need to make a way to attach to the speaker and it would be perfect. Until then I suggest using a speaker with a built in loop or you will risk losing your speaker.

title: I RECEIVED A COUNTERFEIT.
text: I'm overall very happy with the JBL Charge 3.No longer works and sounds very good.(Edit, 7-10-17) It has an internal rattle and it's annoying but since I bought it a while back I guess there's no warranty...after sending an email to the seller of the jbl I have not heard back. If you would like to discuss please call or email me asap.(Edit, 1-13-19) the internal rattle has become unbearable and rendered the unit unusable.Who can help?Edit! Again...Tonight i took it apart to use the battery in my 3+ yr old JBL Charge 3 will an aging battery and am convinced I was sold a cheap fake. So many parts and design were subpar, the list is rather lengthy luckily the battery was the same size and plug too that I was able to salvage at least one part.I'm not going to put it back together but am willing to return it for a complete refund for posting a positive comment about standing behind your company.

title: Easy to lose.
text: I'm a big fan of these speakers.  I purchased this current one in January of 2021 only because my previous JLB speaker had worn out from my constant use.  After a few weeks, the charge was holding less and less and now will not hold a charge even when plugged in.As a side note, I spent 40 minutes with an Amazon representative to help me troubleshoot with no help at all.  The rep ended the conversation, requested my phone number, and wrote that another rep would contact me the next day.  It did not happen.  The Amazon return window expired 5 days ago.  I only want to return the defective product without all of this hassle.

title: Used to work and sound very good. Looking for a Full REFUND ASAP.
text: I’ve had a Charge 3 for years and have enjoyed it. It sounds fine for the price. The original speaker had the firmware updated to a version 7.9 that allows it to use Connect+. I purchased another Charge 3 and received it today. The new firmware 3.9.0.0 does not allow it to be upgraded to Connect+ so the ability to use 2 speakers in stereo mode no longer exists which is why I purchased a second speaker. I called JBL and they are aware of the issue with no ETA for a fix.

title: Does not charge after 1 month of light use
text: I am extremely disappointed with the sound on the JBLCharge 3.  In reviews I read the bass was decent for the unit size.  Unless you play this loud, there is no bass or mids at all. I bought this to replace my Bose that I've had for years.  The Bose is now shutting off randomly which is quite annoying.  However, I removed the JBL unit and went back to the Bose and will just be annoyed.  No comparison in sound.  Although the price paid for each unit is close, the quality is not.  I used the JBL in my office for Zoom calls, videos and background music.  My computer monitor speakers sounded as good as the JBL and you know how tiny those speakers are.

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: This speaker was purchased around ten months ago and already has issues with the battery. It will only charge up to two bars, which is about 40% of the battery life.. This wouldn't be acceptable in something that is charged everyday such as a phone, let alone a portable speaker that is rarely used or charged.The speaker quality is good but the volume output could be better. For the price point I would purchase again if it didn't have the battery issue. I've opened a case with JBL in order to resolve the issue.

title: Speaker stopped working
text: The speaker worked great for a year then it started having charge issues where it wouldn't hold a charge for long, hour tops.You would know the battery was about to die because the audio would get distorted and the red light would be blinking. This is after charging all night and show to be full.After a little research I found out a lot of people online have had charging issues with this unit because the micro usb port becomes lose. You have to open it, braking the waterproof seal and solder the micro USB port back in place.For $130 which is what I paid at the time, this item should be built to last not just on the out side but on the inside.The picture is after charging over night.

title: Above average sound with below average battery quality
text: At first I really liked this unit. The sound is great, it appeared to be rugged. But now it is unusable. After about 10 minutes of play time it shuts off.  EVERY TIME!  I researched it and many people have this issue. I factory reset multiple time, downloaded the latest software and tried several "tricks" to fool the Bluetooth to stay on. No luck I am open to suggestions (I'm looking at you JBL) but I am about to give up. Buyer beware

title: Charging issues/battery life common problem
text: Ordered this for a new home, kept it in the box until move in. Immediately out of the box, speakers blown, distortion so bad it was unusable. Had it too long to return it, but loving my Charge 3 from old days past, I decided to order another. The next one was the same way, but luckily was able to return it. How can Amazon let JBL sell used speakers without clearly stating the fact?

title: After 13 mos it automatically turns off after 10 minutes
text: I only had the speaker for 6 months in this time it basically just sat in my room , did not take it anywhere did not drop it or expose it to water. I loved it but after having it for about 6 months it was not able to stay off it would just keep turning itself back on after turning it off, and it makes a loud noise when on, after its on for awhile it will turn off when not connected to anything (this is normal) but as soon as it turns itself off for inactivity it turns itself off. I am bummed because I bought this product because I thought JBl was a good durable brand, I am mistaken.

title: BUYER BEWARE! SPEAKERS BLOWN TWICE!!
text: It was good while it lasted, which was about two weeks shy of 6 months. Now this JBL Charge 3 doesn't hold a charge. That's just not right. I didn't purchase the protection plan because I thought I would take a gamble on having this for at least a year before it decided to quit on me -- But NOT EVEN six months? I read all reviews, know this was authentic - so my advice is, if you want to purchase this product from Amazon, to consider the protection plan for the first year. I'm disappointed.

title: Broken
text: Battery life came and went fast. I expectect it to last similar to my friends and that was not the case. Doesn’t hold charge anymore so I have to keep it plugged in- in order to use it. Str8 Trash! Hahahahahah! Will never purchase this model again. EVER, in For-E-v-e-r(The Sandlot Voice) Butterflies in the Skiiiesss, I can go twice as hiiiigh, just take a look, its in a book, a reading rainnnboooow.. idk why i sang this song, probably bc the speaker wont hold charge and I can play the song…hahahahahhah

title: Died just shy of 6 months. Buyer beware
text:

 Back on January 30th i bought this speaker, as soon as i received the product everything was fine, the bass sound was way too good and it was really comfortable because is not too big, but after a couple of months of usage (It was a normal use, about one or two hours per day) the first problem was with the battery, at the beginning the battery was amazingI was able to use the product without charging it for three days but around february the battery starts working bad, one day it just stop working, it started sounding terrible as if something was broken inside and i've never dropped it, also i never used this product close the water -although the speaker was supposed to be waterproof- but anyway i've never use this product near to the water.So thats pretty much the reason why im not recommend this product to you guys, its an expensive speaker and at the beginning it works perfectly fine but after a couple of months of usage there's gonna be a lot of problems, with the battery or the sound itself.I would return the speaker the next week and i already asked for a refund :)

title: Str8 Trash San Diego Charge Speaker Hahahaha! Take that you filthy animal!
text: Do not buy this speaker, I purchased this speaker on April 20,2019 after reading reviews. I loved it right until it stopped accepting a charge a few weeks ago. Today I decided to call JBL customer service to report the issue so they can resolve the issue. I was informed my speaker was past the 1 year warranty and they said I can get a 30% discount to buy another speaker...... why would I be interested in buying a speaker?????!!!?? Then they wanted me to pay shipping to send it back??????!!!??? This speaker conveniently stopped working right after the one year mark. The customer service and product are horrible, I would not recommend at all.

title: WORST PRODUCT I HAVE EVER PURCHASE
text: I ordered the speaker to use in my garage. I thought it being a JBL it would sound good, but I found it to sound flat, I have similar Bluetooth speakers by Bose that sound much better. So I ended up returning the JBL and bought a Bose and sound quality is 100% better!

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: The reason I'm giving this a one star is the life span on it I ended purchasing this item 2 years back unfortunately the item has stopped working will not necessarily working and does not play music anymore I wanted to check the warranty on this product and when I went on the warranty on the Amazon page for it it would not give me the warranty information I definitely think this product is really good I enjoyed it for a year-and-a-half but unfortunately the lifespan on it is horrible I would definitely love for anybody to help me out to try to fix the situation and get my item fixed or replaced.

title: Speaker stopped working
text: I loved this speaker so much when I first got it... but around a year after purchasing the base was blown out and it would not hold a charge. I was VERY careful not to get it wet, expose it to cold/hot temperatures, turn it up to max volume, take it to high altitudes, etc. I don't understand why it would die other than planned obsolescence on the part of manufacturers. This absolutely SUCKS for consumers, especially when products are so expensive. Please make products that last and care about your consumer base.

title: Horrible life span!!
text: Returned it. Very disappointing in sound. They warn you that if you turn volume up bass goes away but then some digital thing kicks in. Never kicked in. Returning to my three year old Bugani blue tooth speaker. Surprisingly disappointing in JBL. Don’t know why other reviews say bumping sound no bumping whatsoever and I was trying to use this in my truck cab so at a low volume I should’ve been knocked out of the cab nothing even close. Used it one day and returned it

title: Died after a year and a half
text: The first one that I bought, 3 months and a few days after receiving, wouldn't turn on anymore. And amazon wouldn't refund or replace.I was upset but bought another one, maybe it was just a bad one, right? 2nd one arrived and within a short time had the same problem, amazon replaced it.3rd one, now outside of 3 month return window, disconnects from bluetooth after 5-6 minutes and won't reconnect.My girlfriends same speaker, that is 2 years older, has been dropped, set on fire(accident on the stove), gotten wet, but will connect to bluetoothed mosquito fart, from 100 feet, away in an instant

title: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED
text: I have had this speaker for a year. I love using it and have taken it many places with me. At first I had issues with connecting devices but the product support team helped. Sadly, this product after 11 months has TERRIBLE sound quality. It’s never gotten wet or anything so I’m not sure what happened but in the last month or so (almost exactly a yr after purchase) there is an extremely noticeable scratching noise. I’m so disappointed and more annoyed that now after researching and spending the money I have to do it again to get a better Bluetooth speaker.

title: It only works until the 3 month return is over
text: I have another one of these and it’s great. This one I purchased for our nonprofit that certainly doesn’t have money to waste.  I used it about 5 times for a workshop that I needed a portable speaker for and it just stopped charging. Red light flashing and now officially dead. Tried other chargers that work fine on the other one. Reading reviews that I’m not the only one and apparently it’s an internal thing. Now that it’s dead, I have a brand new lookin expensive speaker that doesn’t work.  Do Not Buy one of These!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Move along and don’t waste your money
text: After couple of weeks started to disconnect from laptop via Bluetooth.  Then quality of sound started to degrade. I connected another speaker and perfect Bluetooth connection and perfect sound. Checked my warranty and apparently I have to ship it to California at my expense. And the last straw is that they want to charge me for a box to ship it.I probably should throw it away and buy from a decent company.

title: Won’t Charge after 5 uses!!! Don’t buy one!!!
text: Speaker lasted 2 weeks past warranty. Called jbl support. Was told that I pushed wrong button's to factory reset it.because it stopped working or charging.they basically said there was nothing they could do and hardware was probably messed up..very poor support and product. Not what I would of expected from jbl. Very disappointed with support and would not spend that kind of money on something that last a little over a year. Stay away.

title: Bad product, bad support, bad warranty.
text: I had 2 JBL 2 charge speakers and loved them. I was very excited to get the JBL charge 3. It sounded awful....Muffled and heavy sound with no range. I downloaded an app. and tried to adjust the sound, yet it just sounded like a 20 dollar speaker inside of a wooden box. I am not sure what happened between the great sound of the charge 2 and this clunker? I went online to see if there were other ways to help ithe sound and found people suggesting removing the exterior to make it sound better. At that point, I wrapped it up and sent it back. Amazon promptly issued a refund. Thank you Amazon. JBL, why’d you mess up such a good thing?

title: Poor product support and quality
text: I love these JBL's and the fact that I can hook up "Multiple" units via Bluetooth. Problem is, "Multiple" means just two. Not three or more. I had two and I thought I could do four so I bought two more. But I can't. On top of that, I can't have two sets of two either. So I had to send two of them back. Thanks Amazon for making this simple.STOP !!!!!!!!!! Disregard...... I love  JBL.... but JBL, Top of the line, respected forever cannot make 4 of these cannot make them work together, synchronize?Really? JBL? Fails?That's a major major  failure and loss of my 50 years of confidence in JBL....If JBL cannot do this, then what is JBL????K-Mart?YES......Its not JBL.

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: After reading reviews and comparisons I was very excited to receive this speaker. I used the speaker 5-10 hours a week for just under a month and absolutely loved it, great speaker for the money. However during the 4th week the speaker got blown out, has no bass at all, and sounds flubbery. I never once played it at full volume and consistently had the volume around 50-60%. Hard to describe but I've owned speakers before and this one is ruined. This would have been a 5 star review if I wrote it 2 days ago but it's a 1 star because I can't recommend any product that fails in a month of normal use, especially at the $150 price tag.

title: Speaker stopped working
text: I purchased this speaker almost 1 year ago. It worked great for several months, but it began skipping with my iPhone connected. The skipping made it unusable. This lasted even after resetting the speaker, forgetting the device on the iPhone, and updating iOS. When replacing my iPhone with a newer version, the problems persisted. It will play for about 5 minutes, then start to skip several times a second, making it completely un-listenable. Neither iPhones have issues connecting to any other Bluetooth devices.I contacted customer support about this, figuring it was still under warranty, and they simply said since this only happens with my iPhones, I should contact Apple.

title: Stopped working in under a month.
text: I got this "renewed" because it had great reviews online. I was excited to bring it with me while hiking, kayaking, and more. When I got it, it was bigger than I thought it would be and the sound quality was compromised. I didn't use it much during the first 30 days and then when I did, it would always disconnect from my computer or other devices im the m I deleted of a song, interesting the song. It's  basically  useless and when I complained to the company, they ignored me. I was horrible disappointment and a waste of money

title: Worked great, then Bluetooth failed. No help from support
text: This speaker was fantastic for about 3 months until one day in the middle of a song it started sounding full of static, as if one of the speakers had blown out or something. This was inconvenient, whatever, so I got a warranty replacement and had a new one shipped to me in about a week and a half. 1 week into ownership of the replacement without even using it enough for the battery indicator to go down the replacement breaks and starts having the same exact problem. Time for round two of dealing with customer service!

title: Terrible quality, disconnects all the time
text: at first the speaker worked great. After the 1st year i started having issues with the speaker staying off while unplugged. and the "Volume -" button instead of lowering the volume began working as a power button.I have done both the reset and factory reset and neither seemed to fix the button issue or the fact that the speaker will not stay off when unplugged. So now my portable speaker stays plugged in when i want it off. Other wise its a fine speaker.

title: Run away and buy a Bose
text: IIt connects to your Android just fine, but don't want to tell you how difficult it is to connect to a laptop or desktop Windows computer.  Was successful once in that feat.  All in all, I do NOT recommend this product.  I am now having to return it because it doesn't hold a charge after using all of 5 times.  I have had to charge it twice in the 45 days I've had it.  VERY disappointed and now I guess I have an odyssey ahead on how to return this to the Seller... Let's see what kind of hoops I'll have to jump through...

title: ALMOST a good speaker
text: I bought this JBL speaker because I had heard & used similar JBL speakers and really liked them. This one sounded muffled from the first time we started using it and only got worse. Probably about 4-5 months after using it, a constant distorted, fuzzy buzzing noise began to get worse. One of the speakers is blown. Very disappointing, especially from a JBL product. I've been irritated for months and finally decided to write a late review of this lemon.

title: Sounds Good when it works
text: Bought them as a gift exactly 90 days ago for a Christmas present for my girlfriend. She's had it all of about 2 months and it won't charge. Switched out USB cables with my known good charger and it's the unit. No returns apparently since it's been 90 days. Charging cables are cheap. Bought two and both mine and hers had the ends break off in the charging port. Fortunately, mine, works with a replacement cable using the same power pack so plan on hitting Amazon for a quality cable. $89 2-month rental for a speaker we occasionally use apparently. Otherwise sounds great. I'm just sorry I recommended it to my friends who have also bought dual pairs of them.

title: Speaker blown after only a few months
text: Ours just exploded DO NOT BUY!!!!!

title: Cheap quality.
text: Update 09/10/2017: I absolutely loved this speaker when I received it (see original review below, purchased in May 2017). However, I have taken it on a few camping trips and it has begun to disconnect from any device I have streaming - my cell, a friends cell, an iPad, an iPod.. it doesn't matter what it is. It will randomly stop playing, but will still be connected via Bluetooth. Sometimes it will not restart and we have to switch devices. Such a sad thing when it was so glorious to begin with! I don't think I'll be purchasing from JBl anymore. :(Original post:Definitely exceeded my expectations! This little speaker has great sound and lasts for a long time!

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: I would’ve loved this speaker if it lasted as long as I wanted it to. About a month of owning this speaker, the sound quality significantly dropped. Now at around normal volume, the speaker crackles when sound/music plays. It is not as noticeable at loud volumes. I don’t know how it is for other genres, but this annoyance easily stands out when playing metal and rock music. From what I heard from several people, this speaker will not last long if it is overused or often played on loud volumes. I am disappointed and expected more from a name brand such as JBL.

title: Speaker stopped working
text: Sounded great at first. Long battery life and portable. Unfortunately after about 2 months of use, the speakers started rattling pretty badly at low and mid volume. I looked up the problem online and according to a few YouTube videos I found, it is a common issue and the only way to fix it is to completely take it apart and re-solder some wires to the speaker. Not exactly an easy fix. I'm looking for a new speaker now.

title: A Great Product Before the Crackling Began
text: I have had this product for less than 10 months, and it no longer works. I tried calling the 888 number for customer service and I get a weird recording. It actually started flaking out a few months ago but was working intermittently. Now it doesn't work at all. It looks like it has charged, but when I go to use it, it will  not work. I want to talk to someone about it, but I can't get in touch with anyone! This is very frustrating! I think a product should last longer than a few months. This is ridiculous.

title: Rattling after a few months
text: I use speakers for my work in construction. Music is very important to me so i try to buy quality stuff. I dont abuse headphones or stereos im well aware of their physical limitations I.E. i dont blast them at full volume willy nilly. That would be stupid. I have really enjoyed this speaker. But last night after playing Stranglehold by Ted Nugent the left facing speaker sounds like it blown badly. Cant even play anything at low volume it crackles and scratches bbaaadddd. Super dissappointed. I have own 50 dollar speakers that have lasted a year or more of good daily use. This is twice that much and blew basicly right away.... Shitty

title: Stopped working and I have only had it 10 months
text: JBL Speaker purchase 1: the USB port crumbled.Speaker 2: purchased in May, 2020 and 6 months later, it failed. I sent it to Harman. The Harman company has yet to tell me anything or make it right!!!! I returned the second JBL speaker after the speaker failed (the inner speakers cracking and humming, bad sound).  I’m so frustrated and after nearly $300, I still have no functioning speaker. Beware!  The Harman Co. need to make this right!!! I will never buy another if this is how the back the products. Shameful!

title: Speaker blown after maybe 10 uses......
text: The speaker was great until it CAUGHT ON FIRE IN MY APARTMENT WHEN I WASNT HOME AND RUINED MY STUFF.Thankfully, the fire didn’t spread, but it certainly left melted, pungent smelling plastic debris all over my bathroom. Many of my items near the speaker during the incident needed to be replaced from to exposure to battery chemical constituents.The fire seemed random. It was not too hot inside, it was not crowded, it was not exposed to liquids. The speaker was literally sitting on a typical shelf in the corner of a typical bathroom.

title: Second JBL speaker failed and was returned. the Harman Co. (seller) has not made it right.
text: Title sums it up. Despite being plugged in, it refused to charge within just a few days of purchase. I tried different cords, outlets and charging methods, but nothing worked. There is a firmware update that supposedly fixed it, but the speaker would only update if it was plugged in, and seeing as it wouldn't detect it was hooked up that was a dead end. I looked up fixes online and found I would have to open the outer case up and replace the charging port directly, which itself would render it no longer waterproof. Only plus side is that I could return it.

title: Do not buy. CAUGHT ON FIRE.
text: I bought this hoping it would be a good stereo sound for my pc but im just going to use my clip 3 that my gf gifted me instead. Its not as loud as i thought it would be. Its waaaaay too bass heavy. Even for people who like heavy bass, its muffled and completely overpowers the treble. It almost sounds defective for 100 dollars you can search elsewhere. Your better off with a clip since at least those have a balanced sound. Astoundingly terrible product from a company i thought i could trust

title: Refused to charge after 3 days
text: The product is pretty great for what it is, but barely using the speaker and never exceed over half the volume the left speaker starts to crackle and won’t stop. Had for less than a month and rarely use it though out the week and it’s already useless to me. Have manufacture warranty, still won’t replace it for me when this product is crap. They should recall this generation for sure. Had other JBL products in the past and no issues what so ever, except for the charge 3.

title: Too much bass. Sound is muffled. Not loud enough. Possibly defective
text: Speaker worked fine until it didn't. Clicked on the warranty info and read it. They don't explain what the warranty for this product is, just lists three different ones of five, three and two years. Called on getting it fixed only to find out it is one year on this product. Seems like a deceptive practice for a company as big as JBL.

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: I LOVED this little guy! I took it everywhere for a whole 2 weeks...then I went to go use it like I had everyday before and BAM! It’s dead! I took it home and  re-recharged it. But, when it finally came back on, the speakers are so blown it’s unbearable to use. I even had it in a protective case and everything. I’m anal with my stuff so it’s ridiculous to have this happen. Great sound, but wouldn’t buy it again.Anyone need a case though, I got ya🙄

title: Speaker stopped working
text: im very disappointed with this jbl charged 3. when i recvd the box its ok but the seal of jbl is already broken, i thought this is ok,but when i try the jbl charged 3 its sound horrible and its sounds like used ,the volume is in half but the bass sound is not good.i did not expect this to jbl and this is the first time i bought jbl bcoz,i always bought bose and very happy.im working in the cruise ship so i dont have much time to go out so the amazon is our bestbuy in the ship.i hope u help me with this and i hope you will do some thing about this.

title: Shoulda got the insurance🙄
text: This product would have been amazing, I couldn't find a single fault in it for the first few months. That was until a few months down the line, when the sound became crackly and inaudible and poor production quality has meant that the speaker can no longer charge, indicating a faulty charging port. While these things do happen, this is simply unacceptable after only a few months of minimal use.I'm really dissapointed as this used to be my most worthy purchase from Amazon, now it's just junk.I'd reccomend heading elsewhere if you are looking for a speaker that can last more than a few months.

title: very disappointed
text: As per JBLHCG Customer Support hcgcustomersupport@harman.com via 89y75jmln5g6pm.i-fijdeay.na88.bnc.salesforce.comGood day ! this is regards with your Charge 3-Stereo mode issue.We already received the response from our team that because of the growing number of issues we are experiencing with the software in the Connect app with STEREO Mode, it has temporarily been disabled until we make improvements. Right now, Party Mode is the only option at this time. We will keep you posted on when the Stereo Mode option will be available again.

title: Not made to last
text: Well, i was very happy with it, until it broke. I gave it a very light and careful use, only at home and from time to time, but seems that the inner speakers are damaged, it have no sound quality and the bass are completly off. There is not official service in my country for JBL, so i have any way to fix it, no warranty in my country. Very dissapointed with JBL, i thought there are hi quality products with worldwide support. I won't buy or recommend any JBL product to anybody. Very dissapointed.

title: DOES NOT WORK IN STEREO MODE
text: It has not been a year and it is not working. I got this for my daughter for Christmas 2019. We been trying to charge it and is not charging is not turning on at all so it is very disappointing to me because this is supposed to be in if the best speakers out there. I wish I could return it and get my money back. If anyone knows how I can do that please let me know soon. Thank you!

title: Both speakers damaged after 3 months of very light use.
text: The battery will not hold after 2 years. I can't recommend it for longevity.

title: Disappointed
text: Was dead out of the box. Won't turn on. Tried every trouble shoot and reset I could find. It won't stay on long enough to even do any of them. Just turns on and turns off. This was a Christmas present so my daughter is pretty dissapointed now. I bought it with reward points through Amazon so I hope they refund me the total amount and not just the 22 dollar difference after reward points. Maybe it got damage in shipping or something. I bought before Christmas was only 90 bucks now the cheapest Jbl charge 3 I can find is 120-150.

title: Only lasted 3 year - You better with Bose
text: I bought this speaker in May. The charging port quit working in July. I had a friend look at it, and he said the cheap prongs in the charging system had bent. When I checked my other Bose bluetooth speaker, it did not have the flimsy prongs, but a solid prong that wouldn't bend. I'm so disappointed. I don't know if I received a knockoff or if this is genuinely what JBL uses for their charging port, but the repair window closed a week ago, so now I am out $100.

title: Dead out of the box. Wont turn on
text: I bought this, despite hearing from a few friends that they had some issues with theirs. Well, I too got screwed. This thing last exactly 7 uses (in 2 weeks) before it crapped out. It won't charge now at all. Plug it in and the charging light (singular) comes on and blinks. But it will not charge the speaker at all. So now, it is completely worthless.DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY ON THIS CRAP!!!

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: I received this speaker as a Christmas gift from my husband in December of 2018. Initially, the product worked just fine, however, after about three months of use, the battery will no longer charge. I've tried configuring the charging cord to see if that was the problem, different outlets, but nothing will work. Finally, after about five months of having this product that will not work at all, I have decided to write this review to warn other potential buyers. I am incredibly disappointed in this product's performance considering the price tag.

title: Speaker stopped working
text: I had this speaker for 1 day, and it worked fine, it was charged fully. By the end of the day, it stopped working, during the time of playing music on my phone, this speaker kept shutting off, then I could not get it to turn back on.  I charged it for one day, and the speaker still would not turn on.  Super Bummed out.  I started a return on the item, and will get a full refund.  Now they won't take back the item.  Buyer Beware

title: No longer charges after having product for 3 months.
text: This was great for about one month. After that and out of the blue, there was this weird static-y background noise that’s never gone away. This speaker has never been moved from the shelf in my kitchen so I’d say it’s defective or it’s just garbage and a huge waster of money! I’ve heard $50 speakers that sound ten times better.  I should have listened to the negative reviews on this one.

title: Stopped Working Fake Speaker
text: Had the speaker for less than 2 months - already a problem with it. The speaker sounds very staticky and Has terrible sounds especially when the base is louder. Problem occurred out of nowhere - contacted amazon to help with warranty issue - they gave me a ph# to call directly to the seller. I called multiple times and left messages and have not been able to get my call returned. Very disappointed with this being a pricey speaker

title: Garbage
text: Speaker blew it's not even a year old

title: Defective after 2 months
text: I should have listened to the other reviews on this product and not bought it. I purchased this speaker on October 31 2021 and it stopped working a few months later. The sound quality is horrible now. $130 wasted on a knockoff speaker. DO NOT BUY.

title: Speaker blew it's not even a year old
text: Recently bought this speaker as a gift for my boyfriend. Once opened we plugged it in to charge it and try it. We noticed it wasn’t charging at all and I was concerned the issue was with the speaker. We used another USB cable to charge it and it did work this way. The sound of the speaker is great but I’m pretty disappointed that one of its main components did not work at all, definitely was not expecting this.

title: DO NOT BUY, SPEAKER IS A KNOCKOFF
text: DO NOT BUY!  The bass speaker seems to blow out and rattles. I have purchased a number of these and this is a repeated problem. Terrible. JBL refuses to honor the warranty on the Amazon page. JBL says it is only 1 year and not the 2, 3, or 5 year listed on the warranty page. See the photo of the warranty that I screenshot from the Amazon page. To try to "resolve" the issue, JBL offered a discount but only if I buy a higher-priced item directly from JBL's site.

title: Charging cable not working
text: I've had this speaker for about 2 months now. It doesn't charge anymore. I've tried different cables and different outlets and it just won't charge.

title: DO NOT BUY! Bass rattles.
text: I though JBL was a music company, not a data mining company.  The app requires your location just to run!  That means no updating firmware or adjusting sound controls.  JBL should be in the music business, not in the business of mining and selling your personal information to third parties.  Sorry, but going back to UE.  Their app is awesome and doesn't require tracking my physical location to listen to good music.

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: Overall this WAS a fantastic speaker.  Front speakers blew out in 7months almost to the day. If you do buy this get the warranty.  Now I need to figure out how to replace my speaker if I even can.  I've read nothing but good things about these speakers and I've never punished it for the fear of blowing the speakers.  Well low and behold today it sounds like plastic bag waving in the wind.

title: Speaker stopped working
text: I ordered this speaker in May,2020 and listening to music there’s this rattling sound when music is played! I don’t play loud music but, sounds like a speaker or speakers are blown! I paid too much for this speaker to not get much use out of it! I don’t know if it’s a malfunction issue or what but, you can’t even hear the music even if you turn the volume down really low!!!

title: Get the warranty
text: Speaker stopped working after 2 months. Bought it for my daughter for Christmas. Sound went down the hill in February. Didn’t fall in the water, kept in good condition and in the room.  Speaker didn’t even make it outside. Easy to connect but didn’t last long. Little too expensive for this low quality speaker. Save your money. Would NOT recommend it.

title: Not good quality for the price of this speaker!!!
text: This thing sounds great when it works. My friend has one at work so I got one. He didnt tell bluetooth turns off and on more then periodically. This is a huge pain in the butt. I have 30 dollar speakers that sound pretty close to the same but no cut outs.  JBL is a great company, I have bought many speakers being vehicle or whatever over the years. This makes me shake my head that this happens

title: Low quality. Don’t buy!
text: These speakers are not compatible with Windows.  They are difficult at best to pair.  They have had 4 updatess to firmware and now the speakers will not pair or play at the same time.  Basically useless since day 1.  Declined any warranty even though I had same problems since purchase and just made do and only used a phone or tablet to play them.Dont buy these speakers

title: Bluetooth cuts in and out all the time
text: I had this product for a couple of months until it started sounding very muffling . Turns out one of the speakers were blowing out and needed Soldering in order to work. My bf had to OPEN up the speaker and solder the wires for it to function. Terrible product. I think I got a defective product advertised as new. Terrible experience for first time jbl customer

title: Never Worked Right
text: The 82% of 5 star reviews is highly questionable. Sounds great, Battery life is OK but linking it to my Flip 4 and my Iphone's bluetooth is not easy. It should be must smoother to link the phone and other compatible JBL devices. I even have the JBL App and still it's a multi step process linking everything together. Not cool. EDIT downgrade to 1 star. This speaker is garbage. Difficult to link, pair, download firmware and their App is worse! Stay Away.

title: Terrible ..Needed wire Soldering after a few months
text: The speaker came to me with a pizzing voice. The quality of the sound is so offal I couldn't stand listining to it for mor than minutes. I think it is a manufacturing problem. It means quality control in JBL factories are not up to it's name. What hurts me more is that I bought it from Saudi Arabia and it cost me a fortune to get it shipped to me. I don't know if the they going to take care of its customers overbroad.

title: Linking it to my Flip 4 is a mess or any device
text: Bought the JBL in April. The speaker would cut in and out and wouldn’t connect to the other JBL, that I bought previously through verison. I thought that I had bad WiFi connection or speakers were to far apart. That is until I bought a new JBL. ALSO, the charge cord broke on one side. Sad that I had to spend extra money. Not sure about the warranty, so please let me know if there is anything that can be done. Thank you, LaCrissa Stone

title: Jbl speakers
text: I would have thought that JBL would create a product that would have lasted longer.  I bought my Charge 3, in January of 2018, and granted it has been over two years, but at the two year mark I noticed the battery was not lasting as long, but by March of this year it would not last more than about 5 minutes after charging all night.

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: I ordered a new product, my very 1st JBL purchase and today when i received I was so disappointed. This is NOT a new product, it has been used. The instructions even had food stains and the box was opened and damage. There are scratch marks under the closing flaps for the USB connection, you can tell it has been used before. See photos.I cannot believe i paid over $100 for a used product! I want my money back

title: Speaker stopped working
text: DO NOT buy more than one of these.  The JBL connect app needed for party or stereo mode does not work and will not see your speaker meaning you cannot run more than one speaker.  Spent hours on this and attempted on different phones and tablets with modern android OS.  Cant believe JBL released this garbage.  Otherwise sound is good for mono.

title: my very 1st JBL purchase and today when i received I was so disappointed. This is NOT a new product
text: I have been a loyal JBL consumer from quite some time now. I was very excited when I purchase this product a year ago, presentation, sound, versatility, waterproof. It had all the bells and whistles that you can expect from a real wireless waterproof speaker.A year has gone by and now and I need to purchase another speaker, the inside speakers are putting out a cracking sound, the speaker is useless. Unfortunately with my experience this product seems that will last you less than a year, and you will need to buy something else.

title: Stereo or Party mode will not work
text: I am almost certain what I received was a knock-off; the speaker came in an unmarked box with no manual or instructions, and the bass fried and screeched as soon as I turned the volume slightly up (not even loud).  Amazon has a continuing problem allowing knock-off items to be sold to their customers, and such seems to be the case in this instance.

title: the speaker is useless. Unfortunately with my experience this product seems that ...
text: This is my second JBL Charge 3. I bought my first one from a crackhead for twenty dollars. Then, I sold that one for $60. I missed it so I bought one through amazon and it refuses to charge. I used it one time, until the battery died, and it will not charge. I've tried multiple chargers and outlets. This one is just a straight-up lemon.

title: Knock-off or Just Plain Bad
text: Sounds like a muffled toy, drops the connection, and just forget about updating it. Maybe I got a fake but I've had sound and connection issues with this thing since day one. Did the update via the app, said everything was good, went to connect and it wouldn't. Turned off bluetooth, turned it back on, still nothing. Turned off the speaker and it wouldn't turn back on. Returning and getting something of better quality and sound.

title: One Time Use
text: My first JBL actually started on fire! I'm so lucky I was standing there. It was plugged in and charging and it suddenly started flaming. It melted right where it was plugged in. I loved the sound quality and size so much so I took a chance and ordered a new one. After a full summer of use the place where you insert your charging cord is all warped. Can't plug the charger in so it's completely shot. What a waste of money.

title: Junk
text: Had this speaker for a little over 2 years.  Loved it but it just got wet from rain for the first time since I've owned it and now it won't charge.  Not waterproof and no longer under warranty.  A huge reason I bought was because it's "waterproof" I baby it for 2 years just to find out it isn't.  Very frustrating.

title: 2nd JBL - Major Charger Issues - FIRE
text: I’ve had 4 of these speakers for about 6 months.  Very complicated to connect more than one.  I have to push button repeatedly  on speakers constantly to get to work. Stereo on 2 speakers is not even worth the effort.  The sound cuts in and out inadvertently.  Using i music and others.  The charge has lasted very well.

title: Not waterproof
text: The speaker has good sound and great battery life. The bluetooth range is not bad but it is not even close to waterproof. The first time this got wet, it stopped working. The back of the unit was sealed as it was suppose to be but it still stopped working. It has been dried out for two weeks and it still won't respond to a charge. Don't waste your money.

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: "new" product was what i purchased. retail box had a small hole in it, this was the first sign (small rip in cardboard, nothing major). Opened the box to find that the 3 month google play card had been taken, and the HARMAN warranty card was also missing. ok thats a bummer but whatever. Unbox the actual unit. the whole thing was covered in a thin layer of dust. WOW. sold a totally used item as new

title: Speaker stopped working
text: My experience with this speaker was bad,out the box and put it on high and my speaker started popping immediately. The sound was distorted so I took it right back and I got my money back. This wasn’t a good speaker for large rooms, it maybe good for children but if you want to hear it very loud I don’t think is a good buy.

title: rip off

title: piece of junk

title: SPEAKERS BLOWN IN LESS THAN A MONTH

title: Terrible
text: Product description clearly states "Build your own ecosystem by connecting multiple JBL Connect enabled speakers together to amplify the listening experience.". In my book, "multiple" means more than two. However, after wasting hours of my time updating the software and getting them placed exactly where they are supposed to go, I call JBL and speak to a snide "product specialist" who informed me that the limitation is 2, but they are working on a software update that "might". This affects the Charge 3 and not the Flip 4 which works fine.

title: Didn’t take long for a speaker to blow
text: we purchased this speaker in May on 2020 and just these last couple of weeks it won't take a full charge anymore. Fully charged it only plays about 1-2 hours where new it would play all day and more. Very disappointing in the product.

title: Not as advertised

I had purchased another speaker just like this one but different color and that one works really good with no problems. Perhaps I ended up with a defective product. Too bad I'm outside of the return window now.

title: short lived

If not plugged in while listening then it sounds like the speaker is blown. Battery is never low when this happens as it happens no matter how long it has charged. Disappointed that it did this after only having it for 10 months.

title: Good while it lasted, defective product.

The return window is 1 month, so be sure to test it out a lot when you get it! Useless speaker now that I can't return

title: Defective
text: After extensively researching reviews online and YouTube comparisons, I originally purchased the JBL Charge 3 based on all the rave reviews - but I cannot convey how disappointed I was with it. Right out of the box, it sounded "boxy", muffled, as if I had ear plugs on - most likely due to it's water-proofing feature. In fact, I was so disappointed that I immediately went out and purchased the JBL Xtreme, of which I had heard before at someone's party (where it sparked my interest in the JBL products). The Hi Fidelity sound of the Xtreme vs. the "flatness" of the Charge 3 is night and day. I can see how some may find the Charge 3 a more "balanced" speaker, however I tend to boost my treble and bass frequencies for the type of music I listen to, so perhaps it depends on what type of music you prefer. I'm a drummer, so I like a lot of treble and full bass. I bought the Charge 3 primarily because I thought it would be easier to use in my golf cart due to it's smaller size. However the inferior sound to me just isn't worth the convenience of the smaller size, lighter weight, and smaller price tag. The "Xtra" cost of the Xtreme was well worth it, and it also fits right in the dash-compartment of a golf cart as well. As a matter of fact, the golf cart dash-compartment actually "serves" as a natural "subwoofer chamber", and the overall sound projects impressive clarity, fullness, thump, and volume. The larger size and weight of the Xtreme vs. the Charge 3 is insignificant to me, and even if you don't listen to the Xtreme at high volumes, the added power and overhead-reserve of the amp vs. the Charge 3, provides a much cleaner and resilient tone. I suppose if someone specifically needs a water-proof speaker, lower price tag, and desires a smaller compact size, then the Charge 3 would be a good choice. In terms of sound qualify, it was a no-brainer - I went with the JBL Xtreme, and I'm returning the JBL Charge 3. Also, for the price, I feel like the Xtreme is a great bang-for-your-buck, especially compared to other units 2 or 3 times the cost.

title: One Star
text: Please don’t buy this brand of speaker and save yourself the annoyance. I owned this speaker for maybe 4 months before I started hearing crackling sounds when there was any bass. It started off minor but within 2 weeks progressed into unlistenable and ruined. I am strongly discouraging the brand all together because I owned the charge two or three (purchased maybe 3 years ago) and had this EXACT same issue. This was the reason I was even in the market for a new speaker. When it happened with the 1st speaker I didn’t do any googling and assumed it was ME because I had had it a decent amount of time (2 yrs) and there was some wear and tear (drops and such) I thought it was the natural life of the speaker. Looking back it absolutely wasn’t me (seeing as its meant to be durable/outside speaker) bc this one sat in once place for 4 months. To fix the problem yourself using the help of YouTube/Google (this is apparently a COMMON issue with JBL speakers that a lot of customers face, just defective that way) you most likely won’t have the tools needed, will need to buy a tool kit ($20-$50), take it apart, & even then it won’t go back to the same sound quality. Plus the “fix” lasted maybe 2 weeks so it seems I’ll have to take this apart until the end of time (not). Save yourself the headache and try a different brand. (When working properly) I honestly love the volume, sound quality, battery life, Bluetooth capabilities, etc etc. it’s why I went back to the brand. if it wasn’t for this I would recommend but $120 for a speaker that lasted 4 months is a waste of money

title: One Star
text: My family includes life-long JBL enthusiasts - from way back in the day with the huge egg-crate foam speakers. After reading a ton of reviews, I chose this model given the speakerphone capability and the allure of the brand-quality sound. I eagerly opened my box and started using it, downloading the app (useless) to try and adjust the sound quality. The issue with these speakers is the ability for you to press the - (low volume) and the bluetooth buttons at the same time in order to turn on the "extra bass" sound. *Even at the lowest levels I heard a VERY loud crackling noise (my teen kids were like: What the heck is that!!!") I was stunned. I literally went into my Amazon account and returned it but only a few hours after opening this box. Curiosity plagued me so I looked up "crackling sounds JBL 3" and sure enough - there are many videos out there that instruct you how to fix your speaker (which involves taking it apart?!). I found that absolutely ridiculous - a product should work immediately upon receiving and no matter if you turn it up all the way or turn on the bass boost -- a product should work without fail. Please do not buy this - or do your research for known crackling sounds - it will happen either sooner or later. Honestly - I wish Jawbone was still in business - they had the best sound for bluetooth speakers in my opinion. So disappointed and like my husband said - JBL is no longer JBL.

title: Defective, DONT BUY THIS BRAND.
text: WARNING:  NO REPLACEMENT BATTERIES AVAILABLE.  THIS SPEAKER AND ALL BLUE TOOTH SPEAKERS BY JBL ARE DISPOSABLE SPEAKERS.  AFTER SPENDING 150.00 OR MORE ON A BLUE TOOTH SPEAKER WHEN THE BATTERY DIES OUT, AND IT WILL EVENTUALLY (2 TO 3 YEARS) YOU THROW IT AWAY IN THE GARBAGE BECAUSE THEY DON'T SELL REPLACEMENT BATTERIES.  SHAME ON JBL!!  CUSTOMERS DON'T REALIZE THIS WHEN THEY PURCHASE THE SPEAKER, BUT THEY WILL FIND OUT WHEN THE BATTERY STOPS TAKING A CHARGE.  LOOK FOR A BLUE TOOTH SPEAKER MANUFACTURER WHO SELLS PARTS FOR THEIR PRODUCTS, ESPECIALLY BATTERIES!!!

title: CHECK OTHER REVIEWS FOR CRACKLING SOUND ISSUES - *Do not Buy - Returned in One Day
