About 8 months after I purchased this, the battery started to go and the speaker would shut down on me, even after a full night of charging.  Then yesterday, the battery "dissolved" and expanded, popping the thing open!  I tried to take it a part to see if I could replace the battery, but it's mushy to the touch and I really don't want that thing to open.  I'm taking this POS to electronic recycling.  Hopefully they fixed this issue in subsequent models.

title: AND IT WILL EVENTUALLY (2 TO 3 YEARS) YOU THROW IT AWAY IN THE GARBAGE BECAUSE THEY DON'T SELL REPLACEMENT BATTERIES
text: Sounds ok. Sounds very muddy, no EQ. WOULDNT BUY AGAIN BASED ON SOUND. but wait theres more negatives! Exposed speakers on the ends make me want to return it. I regret buying it now. I wish i tried the UE products. Stupid people pick it up at work when im not looking and stick their fingers in the exposed ends, or i have to yell at them and look like a jackass, Thanks! All could and should have been avoided by doing what they should have and putting them behind grills.SUPER ANNOYING power on sounds and connect chime. I wish i could turn them off completely.Dont even want to bother with the app it has terrible reviews.Battery life is pretty awful when played loudly, Last for 4-6 hours.The flap on the back that covers the electrical ports is ridiculous. Thin little flap to get your fingernail in which if your a guy is barely enough. And its flexible so you really just want to pry it open with your knife tip.After several months of using this i feel like i wasted my money. Totally kicking myself for not going with the UE route.Terrible choice for a charging plug as well. Yeah its common. And yeah every single phone and device ive had thats used one is completely shot after a while. Dinky fragile little plugs need to go extinct. Its time for wireless charging.. Its as simple as two coils of wire next to eachother. Its not rocket science!

title: Long-term review: battery life is a problem!
text: We've had our Charge for about 3 years.  Great sound, great charge, decent Bluetooth connectivity.Last week while plugged in, the battery blew up and the unit caught fire.  Had we not been home, the house would have burnt down.JBL would not take my emails or calls on the matter for over a week.  They only offered to replace the unit, once I proved to them that it was the unit, and not some other issue (it wasn't another issue - it was a faulty product).They showed no concern for the safety of my family and stuck to their corporate response.  This tells me this may be more common than we'd like to believe.In any case, I'm going to Bose for all future speaker needs, and please be careful when charging your JBL product.

title: Wouldnt buy again. Honestly terrible product all in all.
text: Let me start this review by saying this was NOT purchased here on Amazon. I received this as a gift and had it for slightly over a year (about 15 months or so) of very gentle use, almost never played full volume, never submerged, never dropped, never hit, always kept in an after market padded case when not in use and one of the speakers blew out. I contacted JBL only to find out that I was several months out of warranty and there was nothing they could do, they did however refer me to several local repair shops, all of whom had repairs that started at $100 (nearly the cost of a brand new one!). I feel like this was awful customer service by JBL. Between my close friends and family we own four of these and I feel that for a $150 speaker, my concerns should have been addressed as this was the only one that has ever had issues. I will not be purchasing more JBL products after this which is honestly unfortunate as they are one of the better brands on the market.

title: Big Sound From a Small Package
text: For a year and a half, I absolutely loved this thing. I brought it to pools, boating trips to the river and lake, the beach, bonfires, ect. and never had to worry about it getting wet or dusty. It sounded awesome and had almost zero distortion at higher volumes.Did you notice how that was in the past tense? That's because after a year and a half the speakers started making popping and cracking sounds whenever I used it. I reported this to JBL. They sent a few troubleshooting options and none of them worked. I was outside of the 1 year warranty. JBL's response was "guess you'll have to buy a new one." It's disappointing to see a company not stand behind it's product. They don't even offer repair services. I would have gladly sent this in to get repaired.If this had happened with a $10 crappy no-name Bluetooth speaker, I wouldn't be upset. But JBL is supposed to be a legitimate electronics company. I intentionally spend extra money to get a higher quality product. It's a shame to see their quality and support be so poor.

title: Speaker stopped working
text: The micro usb will recess after a few months, meaning you can not charge it any other way.  Even if you buy a USB to USB adapter, you can not use the regular USB port  to charge it. To repair, you will need to remove 20 or so screws and then solder the connector back, that is, if the pad on the board is not ripped off. Google charge 3 micro usb and see for yourself. Very bad quality on a critical requirement, power. I lost my hard earned $119. I am sure it’s the same connector on the Charge 4. Do not buy! Don’t believe people that write reviews 2 hours  after  opening it, reliability issues take time to manifest!

 JBL has always been a great brand. I’ve been using JBL products for over 15 years both professionally and for consumer use. I recently purchased a JBL charge 3 a year and a half ago and it sounded great and the battery lasted long while it worked. But then it started acting up. I contacted JBL and they just shut me down and said I was out of warranty and to try a local repair shop. I tried to get it fixed with geek squad next, and they told me that the JBL speakers and Bluetooth speakers in general normally last about two years. Mine didn’t even make it to 2 years. That’s absurd to spend a lot of money ($150 when I bought this and even up to $600 for bigger speakers) on products that’s going to break down and they tell you just to buy it again. Geek squad told me to to just buy a new one and get insurance. Pretty upsetting that it can’t be repaired. I’m upset about this and I won’t consider buying JBL again.

text: If you plan to buy one JBL Charge 3, you'll be happy with it. Sound and hardware quality is excellent. BUT - if you plan to buy two devices in order to enjoy Stereo sound, go to Google Play now and read through the JBL Connect app reviews. In order to get the devices paired to listen in Stereo, one need to use the JBL Connect app. With the current firmware/app, it's not possible to switch to Stereo mode without using the app. If you manage to pair the devices to play Stereo, you'll listen to an annoying crackling noise for about 5 seconds before the devices decide to g into the desired mode. We all know, JBL/Harman can do better. I returned the devices because they simply do not work together with the JBL Connect app in a satisfactory way. You don't have to return the app, just uninstall it and touch it never again. As one needs the app to operate the devices (if you want to listen in Stereo), the whole system (device/app) needs to be rated. One star is more than enough.

title: A big letdown
text: DO NOT BUY FROM THESE PEOPLE.. THEY ARE DISHONESTI have given this a one star review because of the TERRIBLE customer service from Electronique Hifi.I purchased this speaker from them and a couple of months later it started randomly turning itself on and off. It was well within the warranty period so I emailed them to organize a replacement. They first told me they could not do anything if I didn't have the original packaging. I then managed to organise a replacement. I sent my faulty speaker back to Quebec for around $25 dollars with the promise of a brand new replacement speaker.A couple of weeks later I received a package. When I opened it, it was just a speaker in a generic box with no original packaging. As I paid for a brand new one and it was faulty, I should have received a brand new replacement. When I emailed them about this, they were very argumentative and assured me that this was a brand new speaker but just wasn't in the packaging. Why would they have taken it out of the box I asked? They just responded with a copy and paste from the JBL website which had no real answer in it.At this point I had been back and forth with them and was getting nowhere so I called amazon. They were great. Told me that the seller was completely in the wrong and issued me a refund straight away. After all of this, I finally went to use the replacement "brand new speaker" and it is also not working properly. It does not pair with a new device unless you reset it to factory settings. Therefore proving that they did not sed a new one.

title: Our fate is over
text: Amazon review: Bought the JBL Charge 3 Bluetooth speaker for my husband for his birthday, he really wanted a JBL because they are known for their superior quality and craftsmanship. What he ended up getting was the complete opposite of that. Speaker worked great for a week, after that the sound quality completely depleted, it is full of static and scratchy notes. The volume has been almost cut in half. It does not get loud anymore. He took it to work with him to use while on his 28 day shift and he is totally disappointed and can barely use the speaker it sounds so terrible. Brand new purchase off amazon, for $149 it lasted 2 weeks tops. Will never purchase again and will NOT recommend to anybody. Go buy the Beats Pill or a Bose, something that will last for more then 2 weeks. Total disappointment.We also bought his father a JBL flip 5 from Best Buy and the same results are happening to him. So much distortion and static it is almost unbearable. 2 different stores, 2 different models, both purchased the same month and both, in my opinion are broken and garbage. Save yourself the trouble of having to return the speaker and buy a different brand!!!!
